channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for MS
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for MS

item.title: Report X-2024010689
item.description:
Report X-2024010689

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-29T15:11:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-03
  • City: OLIVE BRANCH
  • State: MS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: FOUND ON LOADSIDE NOTICED THE LEAK TURNED UP RIGHT, BROUGHT TO QA, DescribePack: THE CAPS WAS LOOSE CAUSING LEAKAGE DurationRel: -1 and MitigateEffect: IMMIDIETLY CALLED QA TO COME RETREIVE AND WAS BAGGED AND BARRELED

item.title: Report E-2024010389
item.description:
Report E-2024010389

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-24T15:11:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-18
  • City: RICHLAND
  • State: MS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal LJS experienced a UN3286 EC1417A release from a 350-gallon metal tote. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 0.5-gallons of product released to a 1’ x 1’ area of the trailer floor as well as the tote body. The lid to the tote was not secure causing a release. The tote and impacted trailer floor were wiped down and cleaned with simple green. All impacted pads and PPE were then placed into a 55-gallon poly drum. The crew removed and cleaned the gasket which was then reseated, they then tightened the bolts and conducted a slosh test to ensure there would be no further release. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report X-2024010688
item.description:
Report X-2024010688

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-29T15:11:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-28
  • City: OLIVE BRANCH
  • State: MS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: WHILE UNLOADING PACKAGE HANDLER NOTICED THE BOX WAS WET. CALLED HAZMAT TEAM. THERE WAS NO SPILLAGE ON THE FLOOR JUST ON THE BOX. DescribePack: THE BOTTLES HAD LOOSE CAPS CAUSING CONTENTS TO LEAK OUT A LITTLE DurationRel: -1 and MitigateEffect: AS SOON AS PACKAGE HANDLER SAW BOX WAS WET THEY INFORMED THEIR MANAGER WHO CALLED QA.
